headline: Affirm Holdings (AFRM) Is Down 5.4% After Q2 Beat And Outlook Hike What’s Changed
summary: Affirm Holdings reported past second-quarter fiscal 2026 results with sales of US$586.65 million and net income of US$129.59 million, alongside a raised full-year outlook. Alongside the earnings beat, new and expanded partnerships with Intuit’s QuickBooks, Wayfair, Expedia, Fiserv and Bolt highlight Affirm’s push deeper into merchant, small-business and international ecosystems. Against this backdrop, we’ll examine how the earnings beat and raised outlook shape Affirm’s investment narrative...

headline: AI Fear Grips Wall Street as a New Stock Market Reality Sets In
summary: Last week, those concerns suddenly spilled over into the stock market.  In response, investors dumped a broad range of stocks, from Expedia Group Inc. to Salesforce Inc. to London Stock Exchange Group Plc.  “Things are shipping out weekly, daily,” said Daniel Newman, chief executive officer of the Futurum Group.

headline: Affirm Expands BNPL Network With New Partnerships And Wider Distribution
summary: Affirm Holdings (NasdaqGS:AFRM) has announced new and expanded partnerships with Intuit QuickBooks, Wayfair in the UK and Canada, Expedia Group, Bolt, Fiserv, and Virgin Media O2. The agreements extend Affirm's buy now, pay later services into additional regions and sectors, including travel, small business invoicing, telecom, hardware, and banking. These developments represent a broad expansion of Affirm's merchant network across online retail, software platforms, and financial...
